summary: TypeScript type incompatibility between Temporal's abort-controller polyfill and standard library AbortSignal prevents using cancellationSignal with libraries expecting standard AbortSignal types. The SDK uses a third-party AbortController for Node 14 compatibility, causing type mismatches with newer versions that have the throwIfAborted method.
userImpact: Users cannot pass Temporal's cancellationSignal to third-party libraries that expect standard AbortSignal types, limiting integration capabilities.
rootCause: Temporal uses abort-controller polyfill for Node 14 compatibility, but its types don't match the standard library AbortSignal which includes throwIfAborted method added in later Node versions.
proposedFix: Either use abort-controller/polyfill which returns the native implementation when available, or manually add throwIfAborted method to objects created, or align types with Node 16+ standard library.
resolutionDetails: SDK switched to using abort-controller/polyfill to return native implementation when available, matching standard library types in newer Node versions.
keyQuote: Execa expects a standard library `AbortSignal` and Temporal is using a third-party `AbortSignal`.
